fields.summary: Support for translated page managment

fields.description:
Here's an easy fix proposal for improving (and simplifying) Confluence's printing a lot: create a new style sheet for just printing purposes. I've used one on a number of occasions and with a print-only stylesheet it's possibly for you to entirely lose the custom jsp code for the "printer friendly" page since you could just set the style sheet to hide the navigation when printing. Could use the same technique for the PDF generation?

At the moment the printed pages have unnecessary "back to previous page "links and form elements which aren't necessary at all.

If you're unfamiliar with the technique, read for example the following:

http://webdesign.about.com/cs/css/a/aa042103a.htm
fields.summary: User print-only stylesheet to make printing easier, more beautiful and more configurable

fields.description: Please add a preference which lets the users define what information they want to export when creating a PDF document. At least make it possible to export a space without comments. :)
fields.summary: Content-selective exporting
HTML import into Confluence

fields.description: Even if a user has requested "text" format daily change notifications, he's sent the HTML version.
fields.summary: Text -format email notifications are HTML-formatted

fields.description: I take a user that can not see ANY confluence spaces to http://wbdevweb4:8080/confluence/pages/listundefinedpages.action and they see all of the undefined pages in the DEV space.  What if a page title was GeorgeSucks and George is logging in?  EEEEK!!!
fields.summary: Users without permissions can see undefined pages

fields.description:
Confluence keeps each and every saved version. The size of the database grows uncontrollably that way. In the administration it must be possible to indicate how many versions of the changed page Confluence should keep.

For my project, as an example, 3 recent versions (or 5 at max) is more than sufficient.

I don't need change of each and every character to be saved as a version. It eats up database space and system, also, becomes slower.
fields.summary: Change log limit capability required.

fields.description:
I create a blog post "test ä" (with a german umlaut).
After submitting it I try to add a comment.
Confluence complains about an   error "The page specified does not exist" and shows the page with name "Add Comment to SPIELPLATZ:Test Ã¤"

However if I look the post directly, it is corretly display as 
"Dashboard > SPIELPLATZ > Pages > 2004 > April > 06 > Test ä".

Looks like an encoding problem to me.
fields.summary: Can not comment on blog posts which title contain special characters

fields.description:
I have both a JIRA and a Confluence installation, Ive had them previously communicating amongst themselves for the authentication. I would like to get them to both talk to Active Directory and use that as a single source of security / group detailing.

I have found a few resources in the forums / mailing lists with fragments of advice on how to integrate Confluence into Active Directory using LDAP, but I have yet been able to put the peices together and get a working installation. (I get various stack traces on Tomcat startup)

What would be invaliuble to users in my situation is a guide (like the "Integrating Confluence and JIRA" documentation guide) taking us through, step by step, what is needed to be done in order to get an integrated system up and running.
fields.summary: Documentation for Confluence Integration with Active Directory

fields.description:
For some reason, a newly created page in our Confluence instance showed up as a create page link as generated by the {children} macro of the new page's parent page. In my understanding this shouldn't be possible? :)

I cured the issue by "renaming" the child by clicking rename link on the child and updated the name without changing the name. After this the children macro came back to normal.
fields.summary: {children:depth=2} can generate a "create page" link

fields.description: JIRA UserProviders currently do no caching, which slows down Confluence significantly.
fields.summary: Add Caching to JIRA user providers

fields.description:
Link generation goes through a pretty tortuous path in the wiki rendering engine, much of which makes some radeox-centric assumptions about what we're sending around and what we're planning on doing with it.

We could probably delete a lot of the unnecessary code, and make the whole thing a lot easier to maintain in the process.
fields.summary: Rewrite wiki -> link transformation code

fields.description: Primary key conflicts seem to occur where there are no conflicts in the export file. This may be another one of Sybase's weird CLOB-handling issues?
fields.summary: Backup import fails under Sybase

fields.description: It would be really nice to be able to email a page to another user or to any email address. One of the things I really like to do is notify certain people after I've added a page... for example, I post a new specification or idea, and I want some feedback on it, so I'd love to be able to quickly send a notification to a couple of people that the new page is there and ask them to review it.
fields.summary: Email page

fields.description:
Situation:
1. User A makes a comment on a page.
2. User B removes the comment

Issues:
1. Since comments are not versioned, that comment is lost
2. Since the comment is lost, does it make sense that User B could delete User A's comment.  For pages, it isn't an issue because the page is versioned.

Solutions:
1. Make comments versioned
2. Make user's not allowed to remove other's comments
3. Make a permission setting so that the administrator can define if users are allowed to delete others comments or not.
fields.summary: Users should not be able to remove other users comments (or comments should be versioned)

fields.description: Index PDF attachments to allow full text searching them as well.
fields.summary: PDF Indexing
Nested lists break PDF export (smart quotes)

I've setup a custom path to the daily backups with a directory that I know for a fact has permissions setup so that Confluence has write permission. While catalina.out has lines

Apr 2, 2004 4:00:07 AM com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.BackupJob execute
INFO: Scheduled 'Backup' done!

the directory remains empty. Do you have any pointers regarding where confluence might be saving the backup? There's no error messages in the logs so I guess Conf did manage to backup something, somewhere. :)

fields.description:
users are uploading files with funky file names.  For example

0182-01, HT29#17.pdf 

The URL should be escaped so the download can be accomplished.

Also, these file names are not linking when using the attachment fileter [^0182-01, HT29#17.pdf].  To a developer this seems obvious, but to the end user, if it can be uploaded then it can be linked and downloaded.

fields.description:
Attaching files with the current forms is very cumbersome. I just uploaded 25 files as attachments to a document and which tool a couple hundred clicks due to having to choose and upload each file separately.

If at all possible, please ad an uploader applet such as the the one promoted here:

http://www.radinks.com/upload/dnd.php

This would allow drag & drop file uploads instead of the single file stuff which would improve the file upload process immensely.

fields.description:
It would be great to have the ability to configure Confluence to use CVS as the storage area for the different wiki pages.

I've always wanted to use a wiki for the documentation of my projects. I've always been restrained by the fact that I cannot save my documentation sources in my CVS repo, along with all the other sources (java, etc).

I guess another solution is to export the spaces as XML and check them in CVS. However this solution is more complex and less nice.

Thanks
-Vincent
fields.summary: Support CVS as a storage solution for wiki topics

fields.description:
This code renders badly:
If you don't have a blank line after ControllerServlet Confluence doesn't terminate the list item in the correct place.

* ControllerServlet
{panel:bgColor=white}
Each top level project (eg. GsMain) has one ControllerServlet.  This Servlet is responsible for directing requests from a user, getting the correct Page and Action commands from the correct ControllerCore and then forwarding the results back the the user.  An example of this class is at [ControllerServlet].  It is configured using the following snippet in web.xml:
{code:xml}
<web-app>
    <servlet>
            <servlet-name>ControllerServlet</servlet-name>
            <servlet-class>org.guidestar.servlet.main.ControllerServlet</servlet-class>
            <init-param>
            	<param-name>ControllerCore</param-name>
            	<param-value>FinController</param-value>        	
           </init-param>
           <load-on-startup>2</load-on-startup>       	
    </servlet>
    <servlet>
        <servlet-name>ControllerServletWGA</servlet-name>
        <servlet-class>org.guidestar.servlet.main.ControllerServlet</servlet-class>
        <init-param>
        	<param-name>ControllerCore</param-name>
        	<param-value>WGAController</param-value>        	
       	</init-param>
       	<load-on-startup>2</load-on-startup>       	
    </servlet>
    <servlet>
        <servlet-name>ControllerServletFlexiSearch</servlet-name>
        <servlet-class>org.guidestar.servlet.main.ControllerServlet</servlet-class>
        <init-param>
        	<param-name>ControllerCore</param-name>
        	<param-value>FlexiSearchController</param-value>        	
       	</init-param>
       	<load-on-startup>2</load-on-startup>       	
    </servlet>
    <servlet-mapping>
        <servlet-name>ControllerServlet</servlet-name>
        <url-pattern>*.gs</url-pattern>
    </servlet-mapping>
    <servlet-mapping>
        <servlet-name>ControllerServletWGA</servlet-name>
        <url-pattern>*.wga</url-pattern>
    </servlet-mapping>
	<servlet-mapping>
        <servlet-name>ControllerServletFlexiSearch</servlet-name>
        <url-pattern>*.flexi</url-pattern>
    </servlet-mapping>
</web-app>
{code}
As you can see, each subclass of ControllerCore shares the same servlet code but uses a different extension.  Calls to the servlent take the form of: http://www.guidestar.org/controller/search.gs?action_searchFin=1&ein=54-1774039
{panel}

fields.description:
In the confluence interface, many of the tooltips for the image links have text keys which are missing from the localization files and thus show a key. For example, the following keys are missing: "action.browse.pages" from Operations column in Your Spaces in Dashboard, "action.space.rss" from the RSS image in Dashboard.

This is trivial but makes takes away some polish from Confluence so I'm reporting this as trivial. :)

fields.description:
# and * items just don't mix real well... 

Try this markup out:
# Item #1
# Item #2
* SubItem BULLET A
* SubItem BULLET B
# Item #3

Bullet A and B show up as numbered AND bulleted items.

And in this version:
# Item #1
# Item #2
* SubItem BULLET A
** SubSubItem BULLET A1
# Item #3

Bullet A1 is at the same level as A, but is NOT numbered.

Sounds like maybe this is a bug in Radeox?

Timo
fields.summary: Mixed # and * items do not render correctly

fields.description: If I drop the following link into a confluence page http://www.petri.co.il/what's_cidr.htm when I click on the link itself, I get taken to http://www.petri.co.il/what's_cidr.htm - this doesnt work.
fields.summary: Unable to link to URL's with single quote's as they are escaped

fields.description:
I would like to see this syntax allowed: |table stuff | infor info| this would create:
table stuff infor
info
Maybe you could have the table header say how many columns should reside in a row.
fields.summary: Have the || table markup allow multi line cells

fields.description:
Currently when you export you select an output type and it appears in the browser. The improvement I suggest is that the user can select (via a dropdown listbox?) the output method.

Either:

* This Window (default and current implementation)
* Popup / New Window (preferably using _blank rather than javascript)
* Save As (allowing the user to download the file, rather than have it displayed in browser)
fields.summary: Exporting shown in _blank style Popup Window or "Save as" File

fields.description:
Any thoughts on having built in usage statistics for confluence usage?
Would be nice if :
- could switch stats gathering on/off
- select a different DB for capturing stats
- have an option move the stats data from the 'current' table to an archive table based on time (e.g. every day) or once a certain volume is reached.
- log userid (or anonymous) of the user in addition to the URL
- log the breadcrumb path rather than just the pageid
fields.summary: Confluence Usage Statistics?

fields.description: If I want to create the equivalent of Foo in Confluence, the markup is [Foo|http://foo]. I think this is common enough to warrant an entry on the syntax guide on the left.
fields.summary: Wiki markup guide doesn't describe named links

fields.description:
Confluence is missing one _very_ important feature: there's no way to set the order of the pages. When I create a document, pages are kidnof chapters in that document and chapters must be ordered in a specific order, not alphabetically, as confluence does now.

I tried to hack it a little bit, and would create special prefixed names for the chaptes:
1. Chapter 1
2. Chapter 2
3. Chapter 3

even though it really sucks (as if you want to insert a page you need to go and rename all the pages after the position you are inserting at, manually) it worked to give some ordering to the All Pages list and helped avoiding the creation of manual index page.

But it still does not work. When I export to PDF, the page names are exported as a PDF index (very handy) but I can not figure out what is the ordering used. It is not even alphabetical, and definitely not anything I can set :( So my hack failed there.

I think a lot of Confluence users will agree that it is crucial to have ability of setting page ordering in some comfortable way. I also use JIRA and there ordering (of say, issue report fields) is implemented in a very comfortable, user-friendly way. Introducing a feature like that, in Confluence, for pages, would be very much appreciated.

Also, the {index} macro is giving an overly complicated thing. Getting a simple index (alternative tag?) that would just list pages by order - would help.

thanks
fields.summary: Page ordering

fields.description:
I am using Confluence for technical documentation so {code} and  {code:xml} macros are one of the most used markup elements for me. However, when I export space/page to PDF (also one of the very important features) the text surrounded by {code} is garbaled. The new line are messed up and text falls out of the borders, that markup puts around the code.

:-(
fields.summary: code macro is totally screwed up when exported as PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1029].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have a feature in the administration section that could close the site for all non administrative users. Users without administrator access would only receive a page that said:
--------

                        SITE IS DOWN


       <Reason text configurable in the admin section.>


--------

This would allow administrators to close the site before doing backups(exports) prior to upgrading the application, minimizing the chance for users to modify anything between a backup and an upgrade/restore.
fields.summary: Site is down for maintenance page

fields.description:
Try to visit: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/templates/viewpagetemplate.action?pageTemplateId=4

The browser stops to respond (verified in Mozilla and IE). Seems like the "setFocus" JavaScript goes bananas!
fields.summary: JavaScript runs bananas when viewing Templates

fields.description:
In a wiki page, if you escape a square bracket, such as \[hello\], then go to Page Information, [hello] is listed as an out-going link.
I noticed this when wikifying some regular expressions which used character sets, e.g. /[Hh]ello/ matches both "Hello" and "hello".
fields.summary: Wiki outgoing links are incorrectly reported (false positive)

fields.description:
After typing a long entry into the Add New Page section, I clicked Preview, saw some minor formatting issues I wanted to correct, so naturally I clicked the Back button on my browser. Wham! All that typing is gone! Forward button to try to go back to the preview says 'Page expired'.
This is a no-brainer. Never have a 'feature' that destroys a user's work. This is why we have Recylce Bins, Outboxes, Undo, Shopping Carts, and all these other metaphors.
Either the back button should not destroy the text in the browser's memory (a la WardsWiki), or the text should be kept in a safety session object (a la HotMail).
fields.summary: Back button after preview destroys edits

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-996].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of January 8, 2013|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Thank you to everyone for your suggestions and feedback on this issue. Based on customer conversations and comments on this ticket, the most prevalent need in this area is the to manually remove specific versions of a page for the purposes of removing confidential information (e.g. passwords). Therefore, in the next version (Confluence 5.0) we plan to provide the ability for space administrators to manually remove specific versions of a page. We will mark this feature as closed once we ship 5.0.

There have been a number of comments requesting additional functionality beyond this for the purposes of minimizing database storage requirements or for adhering to content retention requirements. We have opened another JIRA issue for this use case which can be found at CONF-27701.

Thanks again for your comments and contributions.
{panel}

There are several reasons why it would be useful to be able to remove historical versions of selected pages:

- to remove confidential information which was accidentally added while editing the page
- to reduce the database usage of Confluence, particularly on frequently- or automatically-updated pages
- to comply with legislative document destruction requirements (e.g. delete content older than some years).

Practically speaking, this might be implemented in a number of different ways:

- ability to remove old versions of pages older than specific date (e.g. get rid of anything older than 6 months)
- ability to limit the number of old versions kept (e.g. limit to 5 previous versions)
- ability to remove specific old versions from one or more pages.

These tasks could be done manually via space admin, triggered by an automatic housekeeping task, or done manually for specific pages.
fields.summary: Allow removal of page version history for Space Administrators

fields.description:
If I could attach a file (say test.swf) to a page and then want to include it in that page I could use the macros by doing something along the lines of:

{flash-swf:movie=test.swf|id=test|width=600|height=450|bgcolor=#003366|version=6,0,0,0}

The values loop=false, quality=high, menu=false, scale=exactfit, wmode=transparent could all be defaults. Which would generate the equivelant of something similar to:

<OBJECT classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,0,0" WIDTH="600" HEIGHT="450" id="test" ALIGN="">
  <PARAM NAME=movie VALUE="http://server.com/confluence/download/attachments/600/test.swf">
  <PARAM NAME=loop VALUE=false>
  <PARAM NAME=menu VALUE=false>
  <PARAM NAME=quality VALUE=high>
  <PARAM NAME=scale VALUE=exactfit>
  <PARAM NAME=wmode VALUE=transparent>
  <PARAM NAME=bgcolor VALUE=#003366>
  <EMBED src="http://server.com/confluence/download/attachments/600/test.swf" loop=false menu=false quality=high scale=exactfit wmode=transparent bgcolor=#003366  WIDTH="600" HEIGHT="450" NAME="tls2" ALIGN=""
 TYPE="application/x-shockwave-flash" PLUGINSPAGE="http://www.macromedia.com/go/getflashplayer"></EMBED>
</OBJECT>

Currently I have to use {html} tags and either put the file externally or hard link to something like http://server.com/confluence/download/attachments/600/test.swf which I dont like incase the url changes. Id rather link like I do to attached images and attach the swf. See also direct linking (CONF-989).

What would be even better is to be able to link to swf's / images / general attachments on other pages (eg: if an image is commonly used) without having to store it externally. That might be better in a file repository (see issue CONF-990).
fields.summary: Embedded Flash Movies (similar to embeded images)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-990].
  {panel}

At the moment files are attached on a page by page basis. It would be better if there was also a place to put space specific and global files. 

For example: We have images which are used iconically all over the place in a space, and some which are used over the whole confluence site. For now we have to store the icons separately and link out to them explicitly. It would be nicer to store them in a global / space repository where they can be references something like this:

!image.gif! - image on this page
!anotherPage|image.gif! - image on anotherPage in this space
!SPACE:anotherPage|image.gif! - image on anotherPage in the space SPACE
!|image.gif! - image in the space repository for this space
!SPACE:|image.gif! - image in the space repository for the space SPACE
!$GLOBAL$|image.gif! - image in the global repository

The same could be done for all files (swf's, exe's, zip's etc). We would need some way of linking directly to a file and not just a link to the anchor of file listings. See issue CONF-989
fields.summary: File Repository

fields.description:
Currently if I do [page^file.ext] the link that is generated takes me to a list of attachments for that page. Personally, I think it would be better if it took you directly to the file itself so clicking on it would bring up the save / open dialog box.

This would make more sense to my users when I tell them that they can "click here to download a xls spreadsheet" in one click rather than two.
fields.summary: Direct File Attachment Linking (not just to the file hyperlink, but to the file itself)

fields.description: To install to websphere and co in production we need to build a single WAR file.
fields.summary: Need a war build script like Jira

fields.description:
Currently there is nowhere to put a list of searching / indexing keywords and metadata - like you get in word documents, pdf's and html pages.

Fields to be able to put in non-displayed data to be searched on, and possibly included on outputs like html, xml, pdf, word docs [if Word Exports become possible] would be highly used by us.

For example - our FAQ section is becoming highly populated and in order to navigate easily enough, we are having to use the search function. We dont want to put "faq" on every page just so it gets picked up by the search engine, so keywords and metadata would solve this.

The ability to search inside of a page hierarchy would also be good (eg: search this space, or this from this page and its attached pages - possibly to a max depth of x) ... but thats another issue. CONF-986 to be exact!
fields.summary: Keywords and Page Metadata

fields.description:
Currently you can search the entire server. It would be better if it was possible to limit the search to a specific space, or even a tree of pages. The ability to limit how many "levels" of children to go down (i.e. parent > level1 > level2 > ...) would be useful for large networks of tree's.

eg: ASPACE:FAQs and down 5 levels of children
fields.summary: Search inside of a tree of nested pages

fields.description:
Instead of having just a simple linear comment tree, how about being able to have an (optional) threaded view where replies to coments and replies to replies could be seen as such.

The option to allow threaded comments, linear comments or even comments at all could be on an page by page basis as well as having space / global defaults which you could fall back on (if unselected).
fields.summary: Threaded Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-984].
  {panel}

At the moment I can create pages with names like "To be continued..." or "Stars - Little Galaxy Burps", however I cant create a page titled "Help! I'm a fish!" due to restricted characters in Page Title.

I understand that some extended characters (^, !, | etc) are used for other purposes but I can see there being two ways out of this:

1. Escaping - "Help\! I\'m a fish\!"
2. Implementation of Alternative Titles, so I could set the page title to "aquamarine.fish.helpme" and the alternative title set to something else. You would continue to link to "aquamarine.fish.helpme" but on the page itself (in the breadcrumb trail, in the page display, in the hierarchical view, in the children list etc) it would show the alternative title. [aquamarine.fish.helpme] would show "Help! I'm a fish!" as the link, perhaps this could be an option which could be configured in the administration area ... "Use displayed title where entered?" or something like that.

I think there is an issue around for #2. This could be entirely optional (it would default to showing the page title as the alternative / display title) and the page title could continue to be used with the current characters allowed. This would also make it compatable with previous system data. The tables could be extended to fit on upgrade.

The related issue is CONF-885

Note - this may be a duplicate, but I searched around and couldnt find any issues ... Maybe Im looking in the wrong place.
fields.summary: Extended Characters to be allowed in Page Title

fields.description: It would nice if intranets could restrict trackback pings to external sites (prevent data leakage)
